entry.def: If you describe someone as opportunist, you are critical of them because they take advantage of any situation in order to gain money or power, without considering whether their actions are right or wrong.

example.tran: 贪污受贿、投机取巧的政客

entry.tran: （行动）临时起意的，抓住机会的
entry.def: Opportunist actions are not planned, but are carried out in order to take advantage of a situation that has just occurred.

example.ex: Eric Cantona made the game safe with a brilliant opportunist goal.
example.tran: 埃里克·坎通纳抓住机会踢进绝妙的一球，锁定了比赛的胜局。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who places expediency above principle
1. taking immediate advantage, often unethically, of any circumstance of possible benefit
